description: Senna helped develop it. Gordon Murray daily drove one. The NSX proved that a mid-engine supercar didn't need to be temperamental, unreliable, or terrifying to drive. Honda applied F1 engineering to a car you could take to the grocery store — and it embarrassed Ferraris on the way there.
lore: Ayrton Senna tested the prototype and told Honda the chassis was too flexible. They rebuilt it with an all-aluminum monocoque. In Nova Pacifica, an NSX in good condition is treated with the same reverence as a religious artifact — because that's what it is.
